intro: Ornithogalum beyazoglui, commonly known as the White Turk's Cap, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It blooms in the spring and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
